JobTitle: Subscription Operations Lead, Eater, Uber Eats (US/CAN)
JobFullDesc: About the Role  The key mandate of the US & Canada Eater Operations team is to unlock the next wave of growth for Uber Eats. You will lead all Membership (Eats Pass Subscription) Operations across the US and Canada. You will be responsible for shaping and executing our Membership Operations strategy from acquisition to engagement and retention. You will lead a team of experienced Operations Managers, work closely with our Leadership Team, and drive alignment across the entire organization. The ideal candidate for this role has a proven track record of leading highly effective teams, defining winning subscription strategies, and executing quickly and flawlessly. What You'll Do Define Membership Operations OKRs, develop growth strategy, and execute plans for the US & Canada regionCollaborate with Product, Business Development, Marketing, and CRM to unlock Membership growthDevise investment business cases and recommendations for growth opportunities based on a rigorous cost-benefit assessmentPresent analyses and findings to the Senior Leadership and cross-functional partners Basic Qualifications At least 5+ years of professional experience in Operations Management or StrategySelf-starter with an analytical orientation; empathetic and leans in and embraces rolling up your sleeves with your team; skilled at balancing between short-term needs and long-term investments; thrives on change and comfortable with ambiguityBias toward action and constant push for clarity and executionExcellent written and verbal communication skills as well as stakeholder management, consensus building, and project managementExceptional Excel / data management skillsBachelor’s degree (preferably in a quantitative field such as math, statistics, physics, chemistry, engineering, economics, computer science, operational research) Preferred QualificationsSQL proficiency, team leadership experience, and subscription knowledge strongly preferredMBA degree highly desired, but not required
